page.title: 09WATER SUPPLY IN NEWTON
page.content: Piped{water}didn't arrive in Newton until the 1940's. Before then the villagers relied upon two pits.The{Tea {Pit}contained water for human consumption, and the{Horse Pit}was for all other purposes.At the first pit, the people had to get a stick and stir the green scum off it before they could carry it away in buckets.Some farmers, like Mr. Shippey had a water cart for their farm cottages.The school was supplied by two big water tanks.Sometimes the teachers complained of rusty,red water! Every source of water had to be used.When the jam strawberries were sent away in wooden barrels for instance,the barrels were soaked in the dykes first to make them watertight.The pits were filled in when piped water eventually arrived.
